To whom it may concern,

I had a problem in converting .cti file to .ctml file. Here is the
error message in ct2ctml.log file:

         Traceback (most recent call last):
              File "./.cttmp1122240865.pyw", line 1, in ?
              from ctml_writer import *
         ImportError: No module named ctml_writer

I had followed Dr. Goodwin's suggestion bellow. But couldn't figure
out the destination folder to copy ctml_writer.py. My operation system
is Redhat linux (Fedora). I installed cantera in "/home/zhiwei/Cantera". 

Please advise me how to solve this problme.

Many thanks!

Zhiwei


The 'check' script is run whenever the 'cttmp' script fails, to see if
the problem is with the Cantera installation. Unfortunately the
single-line 'check' script will always fail, since it tries to import
module 'ctml_writer' from the Cantera package (where it used to be),
instead of importing it directly. The workaround is to copy file
'ctml_writer.py' from the 'site_packages' folder in the Python Library
folder to the 'Cantera' folder within 'site_packages'. it seems to me
now that running the 'check' script is more trouble than it is worth,
and I am removing this step from the procedure followed to translate
input files.
